data.title: Mary Neal (Marshall) Wiseman (1721-1790)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Mary (Marshall) Wiseman born 1721 Oley, Berks, Province of Pennsylvania died 1790 Jersey, Rowan County, North Carolina, USA including research + descendants + 8 genealogist comments + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Daughter of [father unknown] and [mother unknown]

[sibling(s) unknown]

Descendants

Profile last modified 9 Dec 2023 | Created 22 Jun 2011

This page has been accessed 2,151 times.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Wills

1.2 Children

2 Sources

3 Acknowledgements

Biography

Mary Neal "Marsy" Marshall was born in Pennsylvania, likely about 1721 based on the birth date of her youngest child (born 1759). However, her Find A Grave memorial reports a birth date of 1702 in Pennsylvania and death date of 23 Dec 1791 in Rowan County, North Carolina.[1] Records suggest that Mary Neal Marshall's father was either Robert Marshall or John Marshall. More research is needed.

Mary and her husband Isaac Wiseman married about 1737 in Berks County, Pennsylvania. Family researchers derived this marriage date from the birth date of their oldest child, Isaac Wiseman I, born 18 Aug 1738.

About 1772, Mary and Isaac and a number of their children migrated from Pennsylvania to Rowan County, North Carolina. Isaac is listed on 1 1772 Rowan County tax list, taken in James Smith's District: “Wiseman, Isac” [sic Isaac] & “Wiseman, William” (s/o Isaac Wiseman, Sr.)[2]

12 MAY 1778 - “Isaac Wiseman entered a land claim to 200 acres in Rowan County "beginning at Maxwell Chambers’ Line Running down Pott’s Creek, Henry Sloan’s Entry from thence to James Wilson’s and south, round to the beginning at Chamber’s Land.”[3]

Mary's husband Isaac Wiseman died 3 Feb 1779 in Rowan County, North Carolina. His grave is located in what is now Davidson County, North Carolina according to a Find a Grave memorial.[4] Davidson County was formed out of a portion Rowan County in 1822.

Wills

Isaac prepared his Will on 7 January 1779 in Rowan County, North Carolina (see Will below). and nominated his wife Mary and his sons William, Jacob, and James as executrix and executors.

And I do appoint my wife Mary and my son Jacob and make them executors of this my last will and Testament in witness whereof I have hereunto set my hand and seal this 7th day of January Anno Domini 1779, Isaac his XX mark Wiseman (Seal).

Sealed published and delivered by the above named Isaac Wiseman for and as his last Will and Testament in the presence of us.[5]

Wiseman's will entered probate in 1779 at Rowan County, Court of Common Pleas and Quarter Session, and Mary and son Jacob qualified as executors.[6]

Mary executed her will on 28 December 1790.

In The name of God Amen, I Mary Wiseman of the state of North Carolina and County of Rowan, being sickly and weak in body but through the Goodness of God being of Good and sound memory and in my senses and Considering my own mortality, Do make this my last will and testament,

and first I will that my body be buried after a Descent Christian manner after my Decease at the Discretion of my Executors hearafter named and my soul to God that give it in the faith and Certain hope of the Reserection at the Last day, and what worldly goods it hath pleased God to bless me with I bestow in the following manner;

I give and bequeth to my beloved daughter Mary Marrell [Merrill] my feather bed. I give and bequeth to my beloved son James Wiseman my Cow and my big Bible and the new Coverlid. I give and bequeth to Elizabeth Marrell [Merrill] my grand Daughter my pieded hifer. I give and bequeth to my son James above named my big pott. I give and bequeth to Ann Wiseman my Daughter in law [wife of William] one of my big shifts. I give and bequeth to Elizabeth Wiseman [daughter of James] the other one of my big Shifts. I give and bequeth to Elizabeth Marrell above named one of my smaller Shifts. I give and bequeth to Lyde (Lydia) Wiseman my Daughter in law [wife of James] the other one of my small Shifts. I give and bequeth to Rachel Marrell [Merrill] my beloved Daughter two Sheets, one blancket and one Coverlid and four pewter plates, one qurt [sic], one tea pott and tea kettle and one grid iron, one fier Shovel and tongs. I give and bequeth to my son James above named one pewter Dish and one pair Stilliards. I give and bequeth to my beloved son William Wiseman one iron trammel. I give and bequeth to Jane Wiseman my grand Daughter one box iron and one cattery. I give and bequeth to my son James above named one pine Chest and one bull and the big pillow and bolster to his wife Lyda and one striped petecot. I give and bequeth to my Daughter Rachel above named two petticoats, one Cloak and one silk bonnet. I give and bequeth to my son James one short gownd [gown], one pair specticles, and I hearby nominate and appoint my son James Wiseman and Andrew Marrell my son in law [Rachel’s husband Andrew Merrill] Executors of this my last will and testament and I Do hearby Deny all other wills and testaments whatsoever in witness hearof I the Sd Mary Wiseman have set my hand and seal this twenty Eight day of December in the year of our Lord one thousand seven hundred and ninty, [signed] Mary her X Wiseman (Seal)

Signed, Sealed and pronounced in presents of Jacob Wiseman, Mary her X mark Paterson

Mary Wiseman's will was dated 28 December 1790. [7]:

Children

Records exist that identify seven known children of Isaac Wiseman and Mary Marshall. Some researchers have identified some other possible children. Seven known children:

Isaac Wiseman I b. 18 Aug 1738, d. 13 May 1818 (migrated to Monroe County, Virginia)[8]

Jacob Wiseman b. 12 Jan 1747, d. 24 Dec 1807 (named in father's will)

William Wiseman b. abt 1751, d. 17 Sep 1805 (named in father's will and mother's will)

Mary Wiseman b. abt 1753, d. 1819, married John Merrill (named in mother's will)

Rachel Wiseman b. abt 1755, d. date unknown, married Andrew Merrill (named in mother's will)

Jonathan Wiseman b. abt 1757, d. b 1779

James Wiseman b. Jan 1759, d. 1837 (named in father's will and mother's will)

Other possible children identified by family researchers, but not proven as children of Isaac Wiseman:

George Wiseman b. 1740, d. 11 May 1816

Thomas Wiseman b. 1751, d. date unknown

Elizabeth Wiseman b. c 1760, d. date unknown

Name: Mary Neal Marshall. Given Name: Mary Neal. Surname: Marshall. A Given name was found in addition to a first name in the NAME tag.

Sources

↑ Find A Grave memorial page for Mary Neal “Marsy” Marshall Wiseman (1702–23 Dec 1791); citing Jersey Baptist Church Cemetery, Lexington, in present-day Davidson County, North Carolina, USA; maintained by Marcia Lynne vonGunden (contributor 47059326).

↑ Jo White Linn, editor, Rowan County Register, Vol. 2, No. 3 (Aug. 1987): 394-396.

↑ Abstracts of Deeds of Rowan County, NC, 1753-1785.

↑ Find a Grave, database and images (www.findagrave.com/memorial/69985375/isaac-wiseman : accessed 23 June 2021), memorial page for Isaac Wiseman I (26 Feb 1699–3 Feb 1779), Find a Grave Memorial ID 69985375, citing Jersey Baptist Church Cemetery, Lexington, Davidson County, North Carolina, USA; maintained by Marcia Lynne vonGunden (contributor 47059326).

↑ Fred A. Olds, An abstract of North Carolina wills from about 1760 to about 1800 : supplementing Grimes's Abstract of North Carolina wills, 1663 to 1760 (Oxford, N.C.: "The Orphan's Friend," 1925).

↑ Wills and Estate Papers, Rowan County, 1663-1978; North Carolina State Archives, Raleigh. See also, Rowan County, North Carolina, Court of Common Pleas & Quarter Sessions, Minute Book 3 (1775-1789).

↑ Rowan County, North Carolina, Will Book B: 179, Mary Wiseman (28 December 1790).

↑ Find a Grave, database and images (www.findagrave.com/memorial/7341046/isaac-wiseman : accessed 26 June 2021), memorial page for PVT Isaac Wiseman II (18 Aug 1738–3 May 1818), Find a Grave Memorial ID 7341046, citing Old Rehoboth Cemetery, Union, Monroe County, West Virginia, USA ; Maintained by Marcia Lynne vonGunden (contributor 47059326).

Will dated 28 Dec 1790: North Carolina. Superior Court (Rowan County); Wills, 1757-1959, Wills, Vol. A-F 1757-1807, Bk. B, p. 179, Film 313801, Image 236 of 777, <https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/3:1:S7WF-3Q9C-79?i=235&cc=1867501&cat=353379>.

Will proven 10 Nov 1791: North Carolina. County Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions (Rowan County), Minutes, Vol. 5, p. 399, Film 313776, image 557 of 870. <https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/3:1:3QS7-89G4-QSWV-Q?i=556&cat=353264>.
